title: Framing: How Words Shape Reality
description: A quick win: understand Framing: How Words Shape Reality.

hook.text: 'Tax relief' vs. 'tax cuts.' Same policy, different words. The framing tells you how to feel before you think.

buildup.text: Framing is the rhetorical technique of presenting information in a way that influences interpretation.

discovery.text: George Lakoff showed that political language is a battle of metaphors â€” whoever sets the frame wins the debate.

twist.text: Accepting someone's frame, even to argue against it, reinforces their position. 'Don't think of an elephant' fails.

climax.text: Framing is invisible persuasion â€” it shapes debate before the first argument is even made.

punchline.text: The person who names the debate has already half won it.

quiz.question: What is framing in rhetoric?
options: Presenting information to influence how it's interpreted
